CONCLUSION: Partly inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of fraud , sentenced her to DATE imprisonment and awarded damages to the victim . The court did not address the argument that the offence had been pardoned by Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was placed in detention , where she remained until DATE .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE , ORG acting on an application of PERSON General ( recurs PERSON anulare ) , quashed the final decision of DATE and ended the criminal trial against the applicant on the ground that the offences committed had been pardoned . It upheld the remainder of the decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an action with ORG , under Articles CARDINAL of LAW , seeking compensation from the ORG for the damage caused by the “ severe miscarriage of justice which had led to her illegal detention for DATE ” . She claimed CARDINAL NORP lei ( ROL ) .

CARDINAL . The case was tried by CARDINAL courts , corresponding to CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction . The courts examined the case either under LAW ( “ ORG ” ) or under LAW . In her pleas the applicant invoked LAW supplemented by the ORG provisions above .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s action . It considered that the facts of the case allowed for the application of LAW ORG as interpreted by ORG decision no . CARDINAL of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . However , it considered , for the first time , that the applicant should have brought her claims within DATE from the date on which her conviction had been quashed ( LAW ORG ) . As she failed to do so , her action was time - barred .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered an attestation informing the applicant that her action had been rejected as timebarred .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant obtained a copy of the final decision of CARDINAL DATE , after several unsuccessful attempts and complaints lodged with ORG and ORG concerning the unreasonable delay in the drafting of the court decision .
CARDINAL . Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the pardon of certain criminal offences and the reduction of various sentences reads as follows , in so far as relevant :
“ Criminal offences for which a sentence of up to DATE imprisonment has been imposed shall be pardoned . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provision on the pardon in the Criminal Code reads as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) The pardon extinguishes the criminal responsibility for the act committed ...
( CARDINAL ) The pardon does not affect ... the rights of the victim . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the Civil Code state as follows :
“ Any act committed by a person which causes damage to another shall render the person through whose fault the damage was caused liable to make reparation for it . ”
“ Everyone shall be liable for damage he has caused not only through his own act but also through his failure to act or his negligence . ”
CARDINAL . According to the provisions of LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL the general time - limit for lodging an action for compensation is DATE from DATE when the damage occurred .
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the ORG prescribe :

“ Anyone who has been convicted by means of a final decision is entitled to compensation from the ORG for any loss or damage sustained where after a retrial it is held in a judgment against which no appeal lies that he did not commit the offence in question or that no offence was committed .

Anyone against whom a preventative measure has been taken , and in whose favour a decision to discontinue proceedings or of acquittal has been given for the reasons listed in the preceding paragraph , also enjoys a right to compensation for damage sustained ... ”
“ ... The claim [ for compensation ] must be lodged within DATE from the date of the final acquittal or from the order discontinuing the proceedings . ”

CARDINAL . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE , published on DATE in ORG , ORG , to which an objection had been submitted alleging that the first paragraph of LAW ORG was unconstitutional , ruled as follows :

“ Under LAW , the ORG is liable for damage caused by miscarriages of justice committed in criminal proceedings . It follows that the principle of the ORG ’s liability towards victims of a miscarriage of justice in a criminal trial must be applied to all victims of such a miscarriage . ... The ORG notes that the legislature has not brought the provisions of LAW into conformity with those of LAW . ... Consequently , bearing in mind that LAW provides for CARDINAL cases in which the ORG ’s responsibility for miscarriages of justice committed in criminal proceedings may be engaged , it follows that this restriction is unconstitutional , since LAW does not allow for any such limitation . ”
